titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John McKnitt Alexander Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution Scholarship Fund Presentation Parchment, 1922 MS 059

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-01 16:39:45 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: John McKnitt Alexander Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution Scholarship Fund Presentation Parchment
did.abstract: A two page document presenting a permanent scholarship for girls on behalf of the John McKnitt Alexander Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution.

bioghist.head: Biograpical Sketch
bioghist.p: The John McKnitt Alexander Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution was formed May 20, 1913 in Houston, Texas. In 1922, it became the first organization to propose and to establish an endowed scholarship at the Rice Institute.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two leaves of parchment, handwritten, presenting a permanent scholarship for girls on behalf of the John McKnitt Alexander Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.
Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the office of Rice Institute President Edgar Odell Lovett, 1968.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John McKnitt Alexander Chapter, DAR Scholarship Fund Presentation Parchment, 1922, MS 59, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the John McKnitt Alexander Chapter, DAR Scholarship Fund Presentation Parchment, 1922 must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten, presenting a permanent scholarship for girls on behalf of the John McKnitt Alexander Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution
